dublin_core.dcvalue: Among the problems facing many radiology groups today is how to cover after hours studies because the demand is increasing while the number of available radiologists is still relatively low There are a number of possible solutions each of which has its own pros and cons and no solution is right for every group Recently there have been a number of companies whose sole business is providing outside teleradiology coverage of after hours radiology studies sometimes referred to as nighthawk services This article describes one group s decision making process in choosing to hire a nighttime teleradiology provider as well as its subsequent experiences and ideas for future solutions
Journal of the American College of Radiology : JACR
